edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject

Class Invincibility

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.InGameObject
      • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Invincibility
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Invincibility
extends InGameObject
    This class is for the Invincibility power up in the game. The invincibility object will keep the player from being killed by the enemy spies. The invincibility object will first be set outside of the board, with a count of 0, and set to be turned off.
    Author:
    Richard Pham, Oakar Kyaw, Ethan Liao, Jeremy Anunwah, Bennett Wong.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      Invincibility()
      The default constructor for the Invincibility class.
      Invincibility(int row, int column)
      This constructor will take in a row and a column, in order to set the invincibility onto a specified part of the board.

    • Field Detail

      • count

        private int count
        This field represents the count for the Invincibility object. It will initially be set to 0.

      • turnOnInvinc

        private boolean turnOnInvinc
        This field represents the turning on of the invincibility. True will turn on the invincibility and false will turn it off.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Invincibility

        public Invincibility()
        The default constructor for the Invincibility class. It will take from the parent class InGameObject. The constructor will set the invincibility to have coordinates outside the grid, and will set it to be turned off.

      • Invincibility

        public Invincibility(int row,
                     int column)
        This constructor will take in a row and a column, in order to set the invincibility onto a specified part of the board.
        Parameters:
        row - the row position desired for invincibility.
        column - the column position desired for invincibility.

    • Method Detail

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Returns:
        the current count.

      • getInvincStatus

        public boolean getInvincStatus()
        Returns:
        the current status of invincibility.

      • setInvinc

        public void setInvinc(boolean invinc)
        This will set the invincibility to be either on or off, based on the parameter
        Parameters:
        invinc - the status of invincibility.

      • setCount

        public void setCount(int count)
        This method will set the count to the desired value.
        Parameters:
        count - the desired integer to set the count to.

      • decreaseCount

        public void decreaseCount()
        This method will set the current count to be subtracted by one.
